author: Unity
description:
Placing light probes manually is a slow process. Unity 6 adds Adaptive Probe Volumes that can help automate the process for you. To set it up in your URP asset, simply set the light probe system to Adaptive Probe Volumes. Then add the probes to your scene.

Learn more in our documentation: https://on.unity.com/AdaptiveProbeVolumes

Find more free Unity learn resources:
https://on.unity.com/learn

#gamedev #unitytips #unity3d #unitylearn
title: Unity Tip Tuesday: Adaptive Probe Volumes #gamedev #UnityTips #Unity3D #UnityLearn

author: Unity
description:
This is Part 3 in the Unity Gaming Services (UGS) tutorial series. In this tutorial, you’ll learn how to integrate authentication with the identity provider Facebook. You’ll continue to use the simple scene that you assembled in the previous tutorial, showing how to set up logging in with Facebook in projects targeting Android and iOS, one of the most common social login methods on mobile games. 

About the UGS tutorial series
The UGS series consists of 10 sets of tutorials, with each set comprising a video and written tutorial. The topics covered in the UGS tutorial series are:

Welcome and Introduction
Player login
Facebook login
Google Play Games login
Apple Game Center login
Player data
Player economy
Virtual purchases
In-app purchases
Rewarded ads

A demo project for more advanced Unity developers
You can also see these services in action, in a new sample project, Gem Hunter Match – Cloud Edition (GHM – CE). The demo project is aimed at advanced Unity developers who have solid ex
title: Unity Gaming Services tutorial series, Part 3: Facebook login
